column8: KUALA LUMPUR: Lembah Pantai MP Nurul Izzah Anwar has failed to reach a settlement over her defamation suit against Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar and Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob.Nurul Izzah had sued Khalid and Ismail Sabri in 2015 for allegedly implying that she had committed treason after her photograph with Jacel Kiram – daughter of Jamalulail Kiram, who is said to have led the intrusion into Sabah in 2013 – was published.On Tuesday, Nurul Izzah's lawyer Shahid Adli Kamarudin said his client's proposal to settle the civil claim was not accepted by the Attorney-General's Chambers."It will proceed to trial for three days from Aug 9," he told reporters here after the proceedings in chambers.Senior Federal Counsel Normastura Ayub, who confirmed the details, said the terms for settlement were not acceptable.SFC Normastura also said that the AGC would continue to represent Ismail Sabri in the civil dispute on the grounds that he had made the disputed statement in his official capacity.Nurul Izzah had contended that it is not appropriate for the AGC to act for Ismail Sabri who had given his allegedly defamatory statement at an Umno function and not in his official capacity.High Court Judicial Commissioner Faizah Jamaludin also allowed Nurul Izzah's application for Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim to testify in the trial.The court set May 31 for case management.In her suit, Nurul Izzah said the IGP had on Nov 22, 2015 uttered slanderous words against her during a press conference at the Bukit Aman police headquarters.The PKR vice-president said Ismail Sabri had also issued a libellous media statement against her on the same day during an event in Bera, Pahang.She alleged that the statements were issued after her photograph with Jacel Kiram was published by the media a few days earlier.In the statement of claim filed in November 2015, Nurul Izzah said Khalid's words meant that she was the mastermind behind the Sulu intrusion.Besides that, she said the statement by Ismail Sabri had implied that she was involved in terrorism.Nurul Izzah is seeking aggravated damages. She is also asking for general damages and an injunction to restrain the defendants from publishing any defamatory words against her.In the statement of defence dated Dec 23, 2015, Khalid and Ismail Sabri said any injuries suffered by the plaintiff were due to her own actions in meeting Jacel Kiram, and that she had no right under the law to claim for aggravated damages and other forms of relief in the civil dispute.Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...6YsSUP7dgAtR.99
